projects.title: Risk Prevalence Tool on iPad
projects.description:
An enterprise app for pruhealth brokers, a ststistical tool for representing prevalence of risk factors using 3D and animated graphs on iPad.

Responsibilities:
- Transformation of a Excel -MACRO based mathematical calculations and tables into an iPad 
 application with inbuilt math and business logic 
- Involved in implementing animated 2D/3D graphs on iPad
- Conversion on graph and charts data into a PDF and enable E-mail.

contributors.headline: Experienced iOS app developer at Egeniq

projects.title: Vitality Active and Vitality Member UK
projects.description:
Vitality active:
An application that would turn the smartphone into a device that records personal workouts (running, walking, cycling, etc.) which can be used to track the vitality points and progress
Vitality Member:
The vitality member app allows you to track the vitality points, view the nearest vitality partners, book a free cinema ticket and acts as a vitality membership card

In these projects I was involved in,
Requirement analysis, preparation of design documentation for all modules, development of business logic, API integration, web services, unit testing of application, debugging of defects. Agile development methodology utilized to ensure timely delivery while adhering to TCS quality standards. I Lead a team of 7 developers and held regular scrum meetings and discussions. The Vitality Active application used a Map my Fitness API to record activities and routes and makes use of the iPhone GPS interface. There was middleware to talk to the backend system and to save and retrieve activity related information. and the webservices were implemented using JSON.

contributors.headline: Experienced iOS app developer at Egeniq

projects.title: PruHealth Quote and apply
projects.description:
PruHealth Quote & Apply 

A quote tool designed for PruHealth Insurance brokers which would help them interact with the customer, capture their requirements, provide a quote instantly on the iPad. 

In this project I was involved in,
requirement analysis, preparation of design documentation for all modules, development of business logic, web services, unit testing of application, debugging of defects. Agile development methodology utilized to ensure timely delivery while adhering to TCS quality standards. I Lead a team of 3 developers and held regular scrum meetings and discussions. The application used a TIBCO middleware to talk to the backend system and the webservices were implemented using XML/SOAP.

projects.title: Document Management System iPad
projects.description:
The user would be able to upload/view/modify various documents such as pdf, ppt, excel and word. A dedicated pdf library was designed that can be used across any project. The user could perform search, highlight, freehand and text annotation on the document. Workflow management was also handled.

•	Agile development methodology 
•	Implemented encryption and decryption for document upload and download
•	Involved in creating a stand-alone pdf library using quartz core framework
•	Web services integration and testing
•	Have been proactively involved in client meetings for demonstration of the application

projects.title: Mobile Point of Sale - Blackberry
projects.description:
The application is developed for a Blackberry device, which would be connected to an external peripheral (Grabba) for scanning any type of barcode (1D, 2D, 3D). This device can also read the credit/debit card details for payment.

Responsibilities:
- Participated in requirement analysis, preparation of design documentation modules, development of business logic using Eclipse Blackberry SDK, unit testing of application, debugging of defects - 
- Interfacing with external peripheral devices such as GRABBA for barcode scanning and a Bluetooth printer for printing the receipts
- Web services integration using XML and used J2EE Middleware, Oracle backend/TCS POS, testing
- Have been proactively involved client meetings for demonstrating the application

profile_positions.description:
I worked on the Baby+ app to implement a feature for their new product launch. The Baby+ tracker app helps track baby’s growth, development and upcoming milestones. The app is trusted by over 50 million parents worldwide.

Responsibilities:
● Led successful collaboration between development team in India and product team in The Netherlands.
● Implemented new features for product launch, onboarding and tracking.
● Followed agile methodology with daily scrum
profile_positions.title: Mobile Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
In 2018 I joined Philips Mother and Child care, on a team to develop an app that connects to a smart bottle sleeve using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). It was a native IOS app developed using swift. The app interfaces with a smart sleeve to get live bottle feeding state information, stored feeds and other diagnostic information.

This project was part of ventures and solutions in Philips mother and child care department. A quick prototype was developed and tested on the market to validate the concept and MVP.

The app was developed and shipped to users in 8 months and it has a 4.5 rating on the App Store

Responsibilities:
● Successfully implemented the Bluetooth communication layer. 
● Took the lead in making architectural decisions, making constant collaboration with the UX designer to make UI flow improvements to be more intuitive and user friendly
● Solely led and managed the project in 2019-2020.
● Direct interaction with end users and continuous improvements based on customer insights.
● Developed a stand alone framework for the iCloud Backup and Restore functionality. This framework can be used by all projects within Philips in any iOS app that requires it.
profile_positions.title: Mobile Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
uGrow - The world’s first medical baby app with connected devices giving personal advice that matters. The app features trackers to record baby growth data such as breastfeeding, bottle feeding, diapers, sleep, crying and photo moments. The app also features articles for pregnancy and for new moms. 

uGrow app connects with multiple Philips products like the smart in ear thermometer, Air purifier and baby camera.

Responsibilities:
● Took the lead on interfacing the connectivity between the app and its multiple connected devices.
● Successfully Implemented device integration with Philips connected ear thermometer using BLE
● Integrated with Philips Hue SDK
● Test Driven Development and Extreme Programming
 

DIComm/Commlib – A Framework that exposes the BLE interface layer to be used across all internal Philips apps to communicate with other Philips products.

Responsibilities:

● Developed a library for BLE communication layer
● Performed Unit testing and UI automation testing
● Code generation using visual studio and python
profile_positions.title: Mobile Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
Prudential Insurance - PruHealth Quote and Apply - iPad  (Team lead) - 2 Years
PruHealth is a leading Healthcare insurance provider in the UK. It is backed by two large international financial services companies – Prudential plc and Discovery Holdings. PruHealth offers innovative products along with great service and support.

There were multiple pruhealth applications involving different set of audience and devices,
PruHealtth Quote and Apply - Quoting tool for Healthcare agents or Brokers on iPad.
Vitality active and Vitality member - Recording avtivities/workouts and managing vitality points and rewards for vitality users(customers) on iPhone/iPod.
Risk Prevalence tool: Enterprise app for pruhealth brokers, a ststistical tool for representing prevalence of risk factors using 3D and animated graphs on iPad.

Document management system - iPad - Developer - 1 Year
The project involves creating a document management solution on the iPad. The user would be able to upload/view/modify various documents such as pdf, ppt, excel and word. A dedicated pdf library was designed that can be used across any project. The user could perform search, highlight, freehand and text annotation on the document. Workflow management was also handled.

Mobile Point of Sale – Blackberry - Developer - 1 Year
The mobile Point Of Sale (mPOS) application on Blackberry can be used as an effective In-store queue management solution (Retail domain). The application is developed for a Blackberry device, which would be connected to an external peripheral (Grabba) for scanning any type of barcode (1D, 2D, 3D). This device can also read the credit/debit card details for payment. This project transforms the static Point of Sale (POS) on to a mobile device, enhancing the user experience and speeding the checkout process.
